item.title: Opening a program other
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“splat, post:7, topic:421929”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=524612.msg3820446#msg3820446 date=1321732781]
AFAIK, those programs have a built in function to make macro’s?
[/quote]… yes they do …each is native to that environment… so excuse me if im thinking to make this script work for more then 1 3d modelling program… though feel free to realise im still a newb to this stuff, but to me seems scripting in this… much better then scripting in something which works only for 1.[/quote]

Don’t feel offended. But to me, learning how to use those programs includes learning how to make macro’s for them.

Read full topic

item.title: Opening a program other

item.description:
@splat wrote:

Thankyou for replying so fast and well ,

Detection isnt something im worried aboout as what ill be using will not be games… im making macroing for 3d modelling applications rather then there scripting language only that way 3ds max users, maya uses and blender users may find use from what ill be doing with it… also will be interfacing with a 3d worldbuilding thing to create maps in a semi automatic mode where things are done via following on screen pictures… all i need are mouse controls and counting loops to help me interface with a few other parts and programs.
this is definately helping alot.

Read full topic

item.title: Opening a program other
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

If you trying to double click something on the screen, try using something like this:

[code=pascal]program new;
{$include SRL/SRL.scar}

var
x, y: Integer;
begin
SetupSRL;
MMouse(1276, 12, 1, 1);
GetMousePos(x, y);
Mouse(x, y, 0, 0, True);
Wait(50 + Random(25));
Mouse(x, y, 0, 0, True);
end.[/code]

First of all, you should always use SRL’s mouse functions, MMouse and Mouse. They are written to click in a human-like fashion and are less detectable. Also, you should always have randomized coordinate clicking and waits because clicking the same pixel every time or waiting for exact amount of time is detectable.

I hope this gets you started

Read full topic

item.title: Opening a program other
item.dc:creator: @splat splat
item.description:
@splat wrote:

Alright so im trying to make a interpreter/new program using simba.
problem is while i can move the mouse and click stuff once i cannot double click at this time.
program new;
begin
movemouse(1276,12);
clickMouse(1276,12,1);
movemouse(32,29);
holdmouse(32,29,1);
clickmouse(32,29,1);
wait(200);
movemouse(636,585);
end.

what am i doing wrong ?

Read full topic
